import math
import random


def generate(use_predefined_values=0):
    params = dict()
    correct_answers = dict()
    nDigits = 3
    sigfigs = 3
    data = dict(params=params, correct_answers=correct_answers, nDigits=nDigits, sigfigs=sigfigs)

    # Unit selection: alternate between SI and USCS if not using predefined values
    if use_predefined_values == 0:
        si_units = random.choice([True, False])  # Decide on using SI units or USCS
    else:
        si_units = True  # Default to SI in predefined values

    if si_units:
        units_speed = "m/s"
        units_time = "s"
        units_distance = "m"
    else:
        units_speed = "mph"
        units_time = "h"
        units_distance = "mi"

    # Value generation
    if use_predefined_values == 0:
        if si_units:
            # Speed in m/s, Time in seconds
            speed = round(random.uniform(5, 30), 3)
            time = round(random.uniform(10, 3600), 1)
        else:
            # Speed in mph, Time in hours
            speed = round(random.uniform(30, 80), 3)
            time = round(random.uniform(1, 12), 1)
    else:
        predefined_values = [
            {"speed": 10, "time": 300, "unitsSpeed": "m/s", "unitsTime": "s"},
            {"speed": 60, "time": 2, "unitsSpeed": "mph", "unitsTime": "h"},
            {"speed": 15, "time": 1200, "unitsSpeed": "m/s", "unitsTime": "s"},
            {"speed": 55, "time": 4, "unitsSpeed": "mph", "unitsTime": "h"},
            {"speed": 25, "time": 1800, "unitsSpeed": "m/s", "unitsTime": "s"}
        ]
        chosen_value = random.choice(predefined_values)
        speed = chosen_value["speed"]
        time = chosen_value["time"]
        units_speed = chosen_value["unitsSpeed"]
        units_time = chosen_value["unitsTime"]
        units_distance = "m" if units_speed == "m/s" else "mi"

    # Error checking for unsupported unit combinations
    if (units_speed == "mph" and units_time != "h") or (units_speed == "m/s" and units_time != "s"):
        raise ValueError("Unsupported unit combination: {} with {}".format(units_speed, units_time))

    # Parameters
    params["speed"] = speed
    params["time"] = time
    params["unitsSpeed"] = units_speed
    params["unitsTime"] = units_time
    params["unitsDistance"] = units_distance

    # Solution computation
    # Distance = Speed * Time  (d = v * t)
    distance = speed * time

    # Correct answer
    correct_answers["distance"] = round(distance, 3)

    return data

A car is traveling along a straight road at a constant speed of {{params.speed}} {{params.unitsSpeed}} for {{params.time}} {{params.unitsTime}}. Calculate the total distance traveled.

The speed of the car is given as {{params.speed}} in units of {{params.unitsSpeed}}.

The time duration of the travel is {{params.time}} in units of {{params.unitsTime}}.

The distance traveled by an object moving at a constant speed can be calculated using the equation:

$$ d = v \times t $$

where:

  • $d$ is the distance,
  • $v$ is the speed,
  • $t$ is the time.

Substitute the known values into the equation:

$$ d = {{params.speed}} \times {{params.time}} $$

Calculate the total distance traveled:

If the speed is in km/h and time in hours:

$$ d = {{params.speed}} \times {{params.time}} $$

If another unit system requires conversion, it will be handled by the computation functions.

The total distance traveled by the car is:

$$ d = \text{{computed value}} \ {{params.unitsDistance}} $$
